question.Q: Did the cramp occur while you were sleeping?
Cramps are common at night during sleep.
Have you been in a very hot place for several hours, and do you have other symptoms such as feeling faint, excessive sweating, clammy skin, rapid heart rate, and rapid breathing?
EMERGENCY Get medical help now! Call 123 or your local emergency number or have someone take you to the nearest hospital emergency department. You may have heat exhaustion.
Did the cramp occur during or shortly after vigorous exercise?
The cramp was probably caused by overexertion of the muscles. However, if you repeatedly have a cramp in your legs when you walk, you may have a circulatory disorder such as ATHEROSCLEROSIS.
Were you sitting in an awkward position before the cramp occurred?
Your cramp is probably the result Of muscle strain.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat and you continue to have cramps.
